abstract.t: Mobile Ad-hoc Networks (MANETs) comprise MANET routers and their attached devices, and connect to the global Internet via one or more MANET gateways. MANET routers that require global Internet access must have a way to automatically configure globally routable and unique IP addresses/prefixes. This document specifies mechanisms for MANET autoconfiguration (AUTOCONF) based on the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP). Solutions for both IPv4 and IPv6 are given.
